title.narrative: INTERSECTORAL APPROACH TO REDUCE MALNUTRITION

description.narrative: By 2022, capacities have been developed in sectoral ministries in the social priority area to provide an intersectoral approach, with effective strategies to combat malnutrition in all its forms in priority areas., which contributes to Health And Development In Early Childhood And Adolescence, Nutrition In Early Childhood, Nutrition In Early Childhood (Covid), Nutrition Of Adolescents And Women. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, mothers, children, adolescents and families, especially the most vulnerable (on the northern border, indigenous peoples, Afrodescendants and others) and/or in emergency situations, exercise their right to health, education, water and sanitation and to informed and effective participation, with a focus on early childhood and adolescence

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2022, capacities have been developed in sectoral ministries in the social priority area to provide an intersectoral approach,with effective strategies to combat malnutrition in all its forms in priority areas.

description.narrative: The CO continues to support national government strategies to eradicate all forms of malnutrition through a lifecycle approach. The CO strives to support national government in the implementation of national strategies to prevent malnutrition; these efforts include evidence generation, advocacy and piloting of models. At community level, intersectoral community-based models aim to respond to the health and nutrition needs of children, ensuring children’s access to a comprehensive package of care to prevent malnutrition. The CO also strives to prevent overweight and obesity through CD4 strategies that reach more than four million people through mass media platforms. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:18/01/2022
